settings.title: The beginning
settings.text: Out of the millions of nude photographs in the world, what sets one apart as unique? To answer this question, we embarked on a mission to curate our own collection. Thus, Unceil was born — at the intersection of boldness and subtlety. We curate with a delicate balance, capturing both the risqué and pure innocence, a refined beauty intertwined with untamed wildness.

settings.title: A seamless art collecting experience
settings.text: Art should not be limited to a posh hobby for few people. But that’s the reality right now. How many times you liked a photography but gave up buying one yourself on the way of looking for a route to buy them in a secure way? We get rid of all that hassle for you.

settings.title: Bringing democracy to the art scene
settings.text: We support artists who want to represent themselves, instead of represented. Not exclusive, anybody who can present quality fine art photography that is aligned with Unceil’s direction can list their artwork here. Decentralised, open gallery that has no old-school restrictions and limitations.

settings.title: Creating a virtuous circle
settings.text: We are basically an online gallery with a full range of service for artists with lower commission. Imagine the collective amount of time that is wasted on artists to commercialise their work. It can be effectively outsourced to someone professional like us. This enables artists to focus and enrich the creativity. The qualitative abundance is what keeps our collector enthusiastic.

settings.title: In awe of innocent beauty
settings.text:
We all have many different awes in our lives. It could be the wonders of Egyptian Pyramids, shimmering turquoise Carribean water, or the eyes of your lover who is sitting right in front to you. To me, awe is an innocent beauty expressed through female body.

No disguise, just bare skin - nudity puts things into perspective. It makes us aware of how small and finite we are, living in the vast expanse of time and space. I simultaneously feel tiny but also a part of something bigger. This sense of insignificance, yet connectedness, is such a humbling yet liberating experience. My passion is to share this with the world through photography.
settings.name: Megan Lee
